wikitext.*:
'''''tâl''''' (pl. ''teil'') means "foot" in [[Noldorin]].<ref name=LR>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 390</ref><ref name=AI>{{HM|AI}}, pp. 92, 150 (note 6)</ref><ref>[[Rhona Beare]], "Conjectures on the Origin of Quenya", in {{PE|6}}</ref>

==Etymology==

*[[Sundocarme|Root]] [[TAL]]<ref name=LR/>

==Example==

*Phrase on a draft of [[Thrór's Map]]: "''[[Lheben]] '''teil''' [[brand (word)#Noldorin|brann]] [[i]] [[annon]] [[ar]] [[nêl|neledh]] neledhi [[gar]] [[godrebh]]''" ("Five '''feet''' high the gate and three by three they go through together"<ref name=AI/> or "Five '''feet''' high the door and three may walk abreast"<ref>{{H|1}} (translation by [[Gandalf]] of the [[Old English]] [[runes]] on the map)</ref><ref>[http://www.jrrvf.com/~glaemscrafu/texts/cartedethror-a.htm Thrór's map inscription] at [http://www.jrrvf.com/haut.shtml Jrrvf.com] (accessed 27 June 2011)</ref>)

==See also==

*[[Sindarin]] ''[[tal]]'' ("foot; end")
*[[Noldorin]] ''[[pôd]]'' ("animal's foot")
*[[Noldorin]] ''[[tellen]]'' ("sole of foot")
